title: Editable Dashboard title, Notes page, and Tests tracking with per-test charts

requirements.summary: Make the Dashboard hero heading editable in-place and persist the title in LocalStorage.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Dashboard (route '/'), the hero heading is no longer hardcoded to "Friday".
The heading can be edited directly on the Dashboard (in-place edit UX) without navigating to another page.
The edited title persists via LocalStorage and is restored after a refresh/reopen.
All user-facing text and placeholders used for this edit UI are in English.

file_operations.description: Create a versioned LocalStorage hook for the Dashboard title (load with validation + save on change), following the robustness pattern used in existing LocalStorage hooks.

Replace the hardcoded hero heading "Friday" with an in-place editable title UI backed by useDashboardTitle (e.g., click-to-edit with Input, blur/Enter to save, Escape to cancel). Ensure all labels/placeholders are English.

requirements.summary: Add a Notes page accessible from the left hamburger drawer with LocalStorage-persisted create/view/edit/delete notes.
acceptanceCriteria: A new route (e.g., '/notes') exists and renders a Notes page.
The hamburger drawer includes a clear navigation entry labeled "Notes" that navigates to the Notes page.
Users can create a note (title optional, body required), edit an existing note, and delete notes.
Notes are persisted in LocalStorage with versioning (similar robustness to existing LocalStorage hooks) and are restored after reload.
Notes UI is mobile-first and usable on desktop; all labels are English.
No backend changes are required for notes.

file_operations.description: Implement a versioned LocalStorage notes hook providing CRUD for notes (title optional, body required) and safe migrations/validation similar to existing hooks.

Create the Notes page UI (mobile-first): list notes, create note, select/view note, edit note, and delete note using shadcn-ui components composed as-is (e.g., Card, Button, Input, Textarea, ScrollArea). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register a new TanStack Router route for '/notes' that renders the Notes page, ensuring it is reachable via navigation.

Add a clear drawer navigation entry labeled "Notes" that routes to '/notes' while keeping existing Tasks functionality intact. Use existing shadcn-ui Sheet/Select/ScrollArea/Button components as composed (do not edit ui components). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a Tests page where users can create/edit/delete tests and score entries, persisted in versioned LocalStorage.
acceptanceCriteria: A new route (e.g., '/tests') exists and renders a Tests page.
Users can create unlimited tests with fields: test label/name and total marks.
Within each test, users can add one or more score entries (scored marks; optionally include date/time of entry).
Users can edit and delete tests and edit/delete individual score entries.
All test data is persisted in LocalStorage with versioning and restored after reload.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create a versioned LocalStorage hook for Tests data: CRUD for tests (label, total marks) and CRUD for per-test score entries (scored marks + optional timestamp), with validation and migration safety.

Create the Tests page UI to manage unlimited tests and per-test score entries (add/edit/delete), using shadcn-ui components composed as-is (e.g., Card, Button, Input, Select). Ensure all labels/help text are English and layout is mobile-first. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register a new TanStack Router route for '/tests' that renders the Tests page, ensuring it is reachable via navigation.

requirements.summary: Render a per-test customizable progress graph (line/bar + accent color) and persist per-test graph settings in LocalStorage.
acceptanceCriteria: Each test displays a chart of score entries (e.g., score over attempts in entry order, or by date if present).
The chart has per-test customization controls that change the chart appearance (minimum: line vs bar; and a selectable accent color).
Graph customization selections persist in LocalStorage as part of the test data and are restored after reload.
The graph renders correctly on mobile widths without overflowing and remains readable in dark mode.
All graph-related labels and controls are in English.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable chart component that renders score history per test using responsive SVG (supporting line and bar modes) and accepts an accent color prop; ensure it is readable in dark mode and does not overflow on mobile. Use existing Tailwind theme tokens where possible.
Extend the Tests LocalStorage model to include per-test chart settings (at minimum chart type and accent color), ensure these settings are versioned/persisted and restored on load.

Wire TestScoreChart into each test section and add per-test customization controls (minimum: line vs bar selector + accent color picker/selector). Ensure controls update persisted test data and all labels are English. Use shadcn-ui components composed as-is where applicable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add navigation entry points to Tests in both bottom navigation and the hamburger drawer, with active route highlighting consistent with existing behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Bottom navigation includes a "Tests" item that routes to the Tests page.
Hamburger drawer includes a "Tests" navigation entry.
Navigation highlights the active route consistently with existing nav behavior.
No existing routes (/ , /math, /physics, /chemistry, /calendar, /customize) are broken.

file_operations.description: Add a "Tests" item to the bottom navigation that routes to '/tests' and highlights as active when on that route, matching existing styling/behavior. Use existing shadcn-ui Button and current nav patterns as composed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a drawer navigation entry labeled "Tests" routing to '/tests', and ensure active-route behavior remains consistent with the rest of the app navigation. Use existing shadcn-ui components as composed (do not edit ui components). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
